alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Greater Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Greenville and northeastern Pickens Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Easley, or 4 miles southwest of Slater-Marietta, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Berea, Travelers Rest, Slater-Marietta, Furman University, Paris Mountain State Park, Tigerville, Pumpkintown, Dacusville and Cleveland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
